bibl.title: Judean Legal Reasoning in P. Polit. Iud. 3-5: A Research Report.
Proceedings of the 27th International Congress of Papyrology Warsaw, 29 July - 3 August 2013.

bibl.note: Polyktor preempts the redemption of a house in a walled city (Lev 25:29-31). - Protomachos and Philotas strengthen agreements with oaths according to ancestral traditions (Num 30:3). - Drawing some provisional conclusions.
bibl.seg: Rob Kugler, Judean Legal Reasoning in P. Polit. Iud. 3-5: A Research Report.

Tomasz Derda, Adam Łajtar & Jakub Urbanik (edd.), in cooperation with Andrzej Mirończuk & Tomasz Ochała, Proceedings of the 27th International Congress of Papyrology, Warsaw, 29 July - 3 August 2013. Volume III. Studying Papyri = The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume XXVIII (Warsaw, 2016) pp. 1565-1578.

Polyktor preempts the redemption of a house in a walled city (Lev 25:29-31). - Protomachos and Philotas strengthen agreements with oaths according to ancestral traditions (Num 30:3). - Drawing some provisional conclusions.
